publicwhip.spmotion: *S2M-1760# Mr Jamie McGrigor: The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final—That the Parliament congratulates the organisers and sponsors of the Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final; further congratulates both the Inveraray and Fort William teams for providing such a spectacular final in Oban and Inveraray for winning the cup for the first time in 74 years; welcomes the BBC‘s live coverage of the game, and hopes that this will lead to more recognition of the key role that shinty plays in sport in Scotland.
S2M-1760# The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final (lodged on 27 September 2004) Alex Neil*
S2M-1760# The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final (lodged on 27 September 2004) Mr Brian Monteith*

S2M-1760# The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final (lodged on 27 September 2004) Mrs Nanette Milne*, Mr Jamie Stone*, Rob Gibson*, Colin Fox*, Eleanor Scott*, John Farquhar Munro*, Fergus Ewing*, Alex Johnstone*, Mr Ted Brocklebank*, Mr David Davidson*, Bruce Crawford*, Bill Aitken*, John Scott*, Murdo Fraser*, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton*

S2M-1760# Mr Jamie McGrigor: The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final—That the Parliament congratulates the organisers and sponsors of the Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final; further congratulates both the Inveraray and Fort William teams for providing such a spectacular final in Oban and Inveraray for winning the cup for the first time in 74 years; welcomes the BBC’s live coverage of the game, and hopes that this will lead to more recognition of the key role that shinty plays in sport in Scotland. Supported by: Alex Neil, Mr Brian Monteith, Mrs Nanette Milne, Mr Jamie Stone, Rob Gibson, Colin Fox, Eleanor Scott, John Farquhar Munro, Fergus Ewing, Alex Johnstone, Mr Ted Brocklebank, Mr David Davidson, Bruce Crawford, Bill Aitken, John Scott, Murdo Fraser, Lord James Douglas-Hamilton, Mary Scanlon*
S2M-1760# The Glenmorangie Camanachd Cup Final (lodged on 27 September 2004) Donald Gorrie*
